name: Glen Alden Coal Company, Appellant, v. State Tax Equalization Board
name_abbreviation: Glen Alden Coal Co. v. State Tax Equalization Board

judges: Before Drew, C. J., Stern, Stearns, Jones, Bell and Ladner, JJ.
parties: Glen Alden Coal Company, Appellant, v. State Tax Equalization Board.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
The decree of the court below is affirmed on the opinion of President Judge Richards of the Dauphin County Orphans’ Court, specially presiding.' gee, also, Newport Township School District v. State Tax Equalization Board, 366 Pa. 603, 79 A. 2d 641.
Appellant to pay costs.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Earl G. Harrison, with him, Arlih M. Adams, J. H. Oliver, William A. Schnader and Schnader,- Harrison, Segal & Lewis, for appellant.'
George W.-Keitel, Deputy Attorney General, with him H. Albert Lehrman, Deputy Attorney General and Charles J. Margiotti, Attorney. General, for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
Glen Alden Coal Company, Appellant, v. State Tax Equalization Board.
Argued January 10, 1951.
Before Drew, C. J., Stern, Stearns, Jones, Bell and Ladner, JJ.
Earl G. Harrison, with him, Arlih M. Adams, J. H. Oliver, William A. Schnader and Schnader,- Harrison, Segal & Lewis, for appellant.'
George W.-Keitel, Deputy Attorney General, with him H. Albert Lehrman, Deputy Attorney General and Charles J. Margiotti, Attorney. General, for appellees.
March 22, 1951:
